Replace.Text: Combat victories provide [ICON_Science] Science equal to 25% of the [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength of the defeated unit.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Cities do not incur war weariness.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]All military units heal completely when this player captures a city with a world wonder.

Receive boosts upon city conquest:[NEWLINE]+20% [ICON_PRODUCTION] in all cities for 10 turns.[NEWLINE]An [ICON_TechBoosted] Eureka for each Encampment or Campus.[NEWLINE]An [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspiration for each Holy Site or Theater Square.

Receive boosts upon city conquest:[NEWLINE]+20% [ICON_PRODUCTION] in all cities for 10 turns.[NEWLINE]An [ICON_TechBoosted] Eureka for each Encampment or Campus.[NEWLINE]An [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspiration for each Holy Site or Theater Square.
Macedonian unique Classical era melee unit that replaces the Swordsman.[NEWLINE]+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when besieging districts.[NEWLINE]50% Additional Support Bonus.

Macedonian unique Classical era heavy cavalry unit.[NEWLINE]Additional +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when adjacent to a [ICON_GREATGENERAL] Great General from any era.[NEWLINE]+5 [ICON_GREATGENERAL] Great General points when killing an enemy unit.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Starts with 1 free Promotion.

A building unique to Macedon (Barracks replacement).[NEWLINE]+25% combat experience for all melee, ranged land units, and Hetairoi trained in this city.[NEWLINE]Gain [ICON_SCIENCE] Science equal to 25% of the unit's cost when a non civilian unit is created in this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May not be built in an Encampment district that already has a Stable.

All Ranged units gain +25% combat experience.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Mines over strategic resources provide +1 [ICON_Production] Production.[NEWLINE]Mines over bonus and luxury resources provide +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
+25% Earned experience from combat. (Ta-Seti)
Nubian unique Ancient era unit that replaces the Archer.[NEWLINE]Stronger than the Archer with extra [ICON_Movement] Movement.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Pyramid, unique to Nubia.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receives additional yields from adjacent districts.[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Food] Food if adjacent to a city center.[NEWLINE]For all other districts that award adjacency bonuses: +2 of the appropriate yield if that district is adjacent.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Can be built on Desert, Flat Plains or Flat Grass.[NEWLINE]Cannot be built next to another Pyramid.

+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity with Political Philosophy civic.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for routes between your own cities.[NEWLINE]Additional [ICON_GOLD] Gold and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture as you progress through the Technology and Civic trees.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Roads built in your territory are one level more advanced than usual.

All units get +3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+5 Loyalty per turn in occupied cities with a garrisoned unit.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Declaring a Surprise War counts as a Formal War for the purpose of warmongering and war weariness.

All units get +3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+5 Loyalty per turn in occupied cities with a garrisoned unit.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Declaring a Surprise War counts as a Formal War for the purpose of warmongering and war weariness.
Persian unique Classical era melee unit that replaces the Swordsman.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Melee class unit with a ranged attack[NEWLINE]2 [ICON_Range] Range.[NEWLINE]Strong defense strength.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Pairidaeza, unique to Persia.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 Appeal.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for each adjacent Holy Site, Campus, and Theater Square.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for each adjacent Commercial Hub, Harbor, Industrial Zone, and City Center.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Cannot be built on Snow, Tundra or adjacent to another Pairidaeza.

Naval units can be purchased with [ICON_FAITH] Faith.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Religious units pay no movement to embark or disembark.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2[ICON_FAITH] Faith to City Centers that are adjacent to Coast or Lake tiles.

Coast and Lake tiles provide a minor adjacency bonus for Holy Site, Campus, Industrial Zone, and Theater Square districts.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity from entertainment to each Entertainment Complex adjacent to a Coast or Lake tile.

Indonesian unique Medieval era naval unit that replaces the Frigate.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when in a formation.[NEWLINE]Formation units all inherit escort's [ICON_Movement] Movement speed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Requires [ICON_RESOURCE_NITER] Niter.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Kampung, unique to Indonesia.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Housing] Housing.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food for each adjacent Fishing Boat.[NEWLINE]Additional [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, [ICON_Housing] Housing, and [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism as you advance through the Technology and Civics Tree.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be placed on a Coast or Lake tile adjacent to a sea resource.

The Religion founded by Poland becomes the majority in an adjacent city that loses a tile to a Polish Culture Bomb.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Holy Sites gain standard Faith adjacency bonus from adjacent districts.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Recieve a Relic upon founding and completing a Religion.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]All Relics provide bonus +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture and + 4 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
Culture Bomb adjacent tiles when completing an Encampment or Fort inside friendly territory.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]One Military policy slot in the current government is converted to a Wildcard slot.
Polish unique Medieval era unit.[NEWLINE]Pushes defending enemy units back from their hex in any battle where they score more damage.[NEWLINE]Defenders that cannot retreat suffer additional damage.

A building unique to Poland (Market replacement).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]International [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes from this city gain +2 [ICON_Production] Production.[NEWLINE]domestic [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes gain +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold.

A building unique to Poland (Market replacement).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]International [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes from this city gain +2 [ICON_Production] Production.[NEWLINE]domestic [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes gain +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
Holy Sites provide +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +1 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing if placed on a river.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Holy Sites trigger a Culture Bomb.

+2 [ICON_FAITH] Faith to Khmer from incoming and outgoing international trade routes and sending Civilization also receives +2 [ICON_FAITH] Faith.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+3 [ICON_FAITH] Faith and +1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity from entertainment to each city with an Aqueduct.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Farms provide +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food if adjacent to an Aqueduct.
Khmer unique Classical Era Siege unit that replaces the Catapult.[NEWLINE]Can shoot in the same turn that they move.[NEWLINE]Exerts zone of control.
A building unique to Khmer (Temple replacement).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Grants a free Missionary when built (if a Religion has been founded).
+50% [ICON_Production] Production for 10 turns after liberating a city.

+3 [ICON_Housing] Housing in coastal cities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Pastures trigger a Culture Bomb.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Yields from Campuses, Commercial Hubs, Holy Sites and Theater Squares are +1 in tiles with Charming Appeal, +3 in Breathtaking.

Australian unique Modern era unit that replaces Infantry.[NEWLINE]+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on Coastal tiles.[NEWLINE]+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on Neutral or Foreign Territory.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct an Outback Station, unique to Australia.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Food] Food for each adjacent Pasture.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Additional [ICON_FOOD] Food and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production as you advance through the Technology and Civic Tree for adjacent Outback Stations and Pastures.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Can be built in Desert, Grassland and Plains.
